title: Meta, Amazon, Snap, Pinterest: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; The Facebook parent's shares plunged on its poor results and gloomy outlook; Other tech stocks were also falling
text:
* Snap, Pinterest and Amazon are all due to report after markets close, and are being pulled down premarket amid the broader tech gloom. Snap dropped 17%, Pinterest fell 9% and Amazon shed 4.2%. Apple slipped 1% and Tesla fell 2.9%. Twitter dropped 7.7%—Keybanc cut its price target for the stock to $40 from $70.

* ConocoPhillips edged down 0.2%. The oil-and-gas company reported a $2.6 billion profit in the recent quarter.

* Eli Lilly shares slipped 0.4% premarket after it reported quarterly profit and revenue that beat forecasts.

* T-Mobile US was a rare bright spot, gaining 8.1% premarket after the carrier reported higher revenue and total net customer additions in the fourth quarter.

* Merck edged down 0.9%. The drug company beat estimates for the fourth quarter after chalking up more than $950 million in sales from its Covid-19 antiviral molnupiravir.

* Qualcomm posted strong quarterly earnings and gave an upbeat sales outlook, underscoring that demand for chips for everything from smartphones to cars remains elevated. But good news can't always overcome a bad mood—its shares slipped 1.4% premarket.

Chart of the Day

* January's market turmoil hit even the safest bond funds. Some of those that held up best strayed from their traditional investing grounds, or concentrated on the shortest maturities.
